    • TylerTestCases

      public TylerTestCases()

  • Method Details

    • TestMessageConfirm

      public void TestMessageConfirm()
      Verifies that sending a message between two users successfully stores it in the DM table.

      This test calls sendMessage() to insert a message and then retrieves messages between the same users using getMessagesFromDMTable(). It asserts that the resulting list contains at least one message.

      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database error occurs during message insertion
      Since:
      2025-11-02

    • TestUserSignUp

      public void TestUserSignUp()
      Verifies that a new user can be registered and found in the users table.

      This test connects to the database, registers a user, asserts their presence via doesUserExist(), then cleans up by force-deleting the user and closing the connection.

      Since:
      2025-11-02

    • TestMultiRolesUser

      public void TestMultiRolesUser()
      Verifies that multiple role values can be successfully assigned and retrieved for a user.

      This test creates a new user, connects to the database, and repeatedly updates the user's roles field with different integer bitmask values. After each update, the test asserts that getUserRole() returns the exact value assigned. This ensures that the role update and retrieval logic in DatabaseHelper functions correctly for various role combinations.

      After completing all updates, the test removes the test user and closes the database connection to maintain a clean testing environment.

      Since:
      2025-11-02

    • TestDMTableExists

      public void TestDMTableExists()
      Verifies that direct message (DM) tables are created automatically and can store messages between two users.

      This test connects to the database, sends two messages between test_user1 and test_user2, retrieves them from the corresponding DM table, and asserts that the total number of stored messages equals two.

      After verification, the DM table is dropped to restore the database to a clean state.

      Since:
      2025-11-02

    • TestUserDelete

      public void TestUserDelete()
      Verifies that user deletion behavior correctly respects admin restrictions.

      This test iterates through multiple role configurations to ensure that:

      • Users without the admin bit set can be deleted normally using deleteUser().
      • Users with the admin bit set cannot be deleted using deleteUser(), but can be forcibly removed with forceDeleteUser().

      For each iteration, the test ensures a clean state by first attempting to forcibly remove any existing user with the same username. It then registers the user, checks their role, and verifies correct deletion behavior. After completion, the database connection is closed.

      Since:
      2025-11-02
